text: after successfully install centos 7.5 via using the community bootenvs; i can’t install any packages on this host. any suggestions?

# yum install epel-release
Loaded plugins: fastestmirror
Loading mirror speeds from cached hostfile
No package epel-release available.
Error: Nothing to do
My apologies <@UBU0BPRA9>, should have sent this last night $Welcome
Digital Rebar welcome information is here > <http://rebar.digital/community/welcome.html>

<@UANLCF8QP> - can you `ls -l /etc/yum.repos.d/` on that built machine?   I just ran through the stock C7 install.  We should be writing a `00-rebar.repo` which contains `centos-7-everything-extras` named repo that resolves that pkg successfully
did you use the `package-repositories` feature?  or use a customized kickstart (eg. via `select-kickseed`)?

files.title: epel-release in stock build

text:
I have been trying to figure out why I have this error whenever I try to clone or create a new template(both using CLI or Ux):
Error: Templates[3]: No common template for centos-6.ks.tmpl
I can only clone and create new templates if I remove "os-other" package, however, I need this package for ESXi. 
any idea why is this happening ?
<@UBBSHF675> not sure at the moment, will look in to it

<@U6QFVRJNB> ls -al /etc/yum.repos.d/
total 12
drwxr-xr-x.  2 root root 4096 Jul 19 22:04 .
drwxr-xr-x. 75 root root 4096 Jul 19 22:07 ..
-rw-r--r--.  1 root root  145 Jul 19 22:04 00-rebar.repo
can you check for the repo definition in that 00-rebar.repo file  (centos-7-everything-extras)

baseurl is pointed to my provision server
[centos-7.5.1804-install]
name=centos-7.5.1804 - centos-7.5.1804-install
baseurl=<http://10.11.110.50:8091/centos-7.5.1804/install>
gpgcheck=0
i’m still learning DR provision…

ok - copy that 00... file out of there - then see if you can do this:
`yum -y reinstall centos-release`
if that pkg is available it should rewire the distro default repos back in place
if it does - then you can delete the 00-rebar.repo file
i got these messages after moved the 00… file and run that “yum -y …”

[centos-7.5.1804-install]
name=centos-7.5.1804 - centos-7.5.1804-install
baseurl=<http://10.11.110.50:8091/centos-7.5.1804/install>
gpgcheck=0
sorry

# yum -y reinstall centos-release
Loaded plugins: fastestmirror
Loading mirror speeds from cached hostfile
There are no enabled repos.
 Run “yum repolist all” to see the repos you have.
 To enable Red Hat Subscription Management repositories:
     subscription-manager repos --enable <repo>
 To enable custom repositories:
     yum-config-manager --enable <repo>
copy that file out - don't move it ...
if you move it, there won't be any repo definitions for `yum` to operate against :slightly_smiling_face:
yeah, it works
did you set the `local-repos` only Param in Global profile, or on the Machine ?
how come copy the 00.. file works?
in the Global profile

the 00... file contains a modified set of Repo definitions so we can customize them according to your needs - for example if you have a local Mirror of the packages you want (or need to because of security) to use
don't do `local-repo`, please
that is deprecated, and going away
ok
the repo system will do the "right thing" by default - and let you override the repositories to use if desired - via the `package-repositories` Parameter
example:  <https://provision.readthedocs.io/en/tip/doc/arch/data.html?highlight=package-repositories#the-package-repositories-param>
thanks a lot!
NP
